articles.headline: 7 Charged as F.B.I. Closes a Top File-Sharing Site
articles.snippet: The federal authorities said Megaupload was an international enterprise based on Internet piracy.
articles.abstract: The federal authorities said Megaupload was an international enterprise based on Internet piracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: In what the federal authorities on Thursday called one of the largest criminal copyright cases ever brought, the Justice Department and the Federal Bureau of Investigation seized the Web site Megaupload and charged seven people connected with it with running an international enterprise based on Internet piracy.

articles.headline: Unearned, and Taxed Unequally
articles.snippet: In the United States, dividends and capital gains are taxed at lower rates than wages, but that has not always been the case.
articles.abstract: In the United States, dividends and capital gains are taxed at lower rates than wages, but that has not always been the case.

articles.headline: An Ethnic War Is Rekindled in Myanmar
articles.snippet: The Burmese military’s offensive against the Kachin in northern Myanmar is raising human rights concerns among American officials.
articles.abstract: The Burmese military’s offensive against the Kachin in northern Myanmar is raising human rights concerns among American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAIJA YANG, Myanmar — Even as the Burmese government initiates political reforms in much of the country, it has intensified an ethnic civil war here in the resource-rich hills of northern Myanmar, a conflict that at once threatens its warming trend with the United States and could alienate Chinese officials concerned about stability on the border.

articles.headline: 8 Guilty for Prison Massacre in Rare Trial of Haiti’s Police
articles.snippet: The convicted police officers were among 14 tried for a prison massacre that occurred a week after the 2010 earthquake.
articles.abstract: The convicted police officers were among 14 tried for a prison massacre that occurred a week after the 2010 earthquake.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a country where officials who abuse their power are almost never held accountable, 8 of 14 police officers tried for a 2010 prison massacre were found guilty on Thursday in the southern city of Les Cayes, Haiti.
articles.byline: By Deborah Sontag and Walt Bogdanich

articles.headline: Public Outcry Over Antipiracy Bills Began as Grass-Roots Grumbling
articles.snippet: It is no coincidence that the social sites with the loudest voices in opposition to the Stop Online Piracy Act and the Protect Intellectual Property Act had the most to lose if it passed.
articles.abstract: It is no coincidence that the social sites with the loudest voices in opposition to the Stop Online Piracy Act and the Protect Intellectual Property Act had the most to lose if it passed.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Wikipedia went dark and Google blacked out its logo on Wednesday, millions of people could not help but notice. For most, it was the first time that they had heard about two antipiracy bills. One puzzled Twitter user wrote: “Isn’t a SOPA some kind of food?”

articles.headline: Dodd Calls for Hollywood and Silicon Valley to Meet
articles.snippet: Christopher Dodd, the president of the Motion Picture Association of America, suggested the White House convene a meeting to discuss antipiracy.
articles.abstract: Christopher Dodd, the president of the Motion Picture Association of America, suggested the White House convene a meeting to discuss antipiracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Jack Valenti walked the halls of Congress, friends by the dozen gripped, grinned and took note of what was worrying the movie industry’s dapper chief lobbyist.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Edward Wyatt

articles.headline: For Gingrich, Rival’s Gift and an Ex-Wife’s Sting
articles.snippet: Newt Gingrich got a big lift for his campaign when Rick Perry dropped out of the race, but there was also a damaging claim from an ex-wife.
articles.abstract: Newt Gingrich got a big lift for his campaign when Rick Perry dropped out of the race, but there was also a damaging claim from an ex-wife.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — A moment that Newt Gingrich had long been hoping for and one that he had long been dreading collided on Thursday as a new opening for him to rally conservatives around his candidacy was suddenly complicated when the second of his three wives stepped forward to say he had asked for an “open marriage.”
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Santorum Rose Quickly From Reformer to Insider
articles.snippet: When Rick Santorum entered the House in 1991, he joined with a group of other freshmen to shame the House leadership into releasing the names of those who bounced checks at the House bank.
articles.abstract: When Rick Santorum entered the House in 1991, he joined with a group of other freshmen to shame the House leadership into releasing the names of those who bounced checks at the House bank.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rick Santorum arrived on Capitol Hill as a new member of Congress in January 1991, 32 years old and bristling with the impatience of a man looking to kick up a fuss. Eight months later, he got his chance when he learned of lawmaker overdrafts at the little-known House bank.

articles.headline: Afghanistan’s Soldiers Step Up Killings of Allied Forces
articles.snippet: Ill will and mistrust run deep among civilians and militaries on both sides, raising questions about what future role the United States and its allies can expect to play in Afghanistan.
articles.abstract: Ill will and mistrust run deep among civilians and militaries on both sides, raising questions about what future role the United States and its allies can expect to play in Afghanistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — American and other coalition forces here are being killed in increasing numbers by the very Afghan soldiers they fight alongside and train, in attacks motivated by deep-seated animosity between the supposedly allied forces, according to American and Afghan officers and a classified coalition report.
